result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny W. Beckstead was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
6/4/18: Terminated from Community Service. Credit given for completion of 46 hours. Must serve remaining hours as alternate sentence.
8/17/2015: Remaining Court Appointed Attorney fees in amount of $0 due to Eau Claire County Clerk of Courts.
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Sentence credit if revoked to be determined by stipulation of counsel.
**8/27/2015; Amended to change offense date to "on or between September 1, 2013 and September 21, 2013"
**8/27/2015: Amended to grant 7 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.
**9/04/2015: Amended per Order signed 9/03/15 changing offense date to January 16, 2014.
Concurrent with: 15CF76

miscConds.notes:
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with his children unless DHS approves and supervises.

Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.
Provide DNA sample and pay fee.
Undergo AODA and follow-through with recommendations (AODA completed through DHS sufficient if agent approves)
No use or possession of weapons or firearms.

PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
8/17/2015: Remaining Court Appointed Attorney fees in amount of $0 due to Eau Claire County Clerk of Courts.

timeConds.notes:
Huber granted for any reason the jail determines he is eligible.
May be served by 360 hours of community service- Defendant chooses community service.

records.addlTxt: Probation Discharge as of 8/13/18
Capias cancelled. In jail here 7/13/18 per Donna - Eau Claire County Jail.
Capias issued for failure to appear for mandated sentence due to the termination from the Community Service program.  Huber has been revoked.
6/4/18: Terminated from Community Service. Credit given for completion of 46 hours. Must serve remaining hours as alternate sentence.

Participation in the Eau Claire County Community Service Program was terminated because the Defendant failed to comply with the Program requirements. Credit has been given for the completion of 46 hours. Must completion remaining hours as alternate sentence.
